channel.title: New Idea for bot, no sourcecode or deob required
channel.description:
well winterlove's(is it winterlove? it appears to be) comment here got me thinking: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,3362.msg35177.html#msg35177 and since I know I have no where near the required skills , knowledge, or time to start a project such as this, naturally I started searching on google for others from whom I could leech(learn) :P I found this: www.IguanaJ.org
Iguana/J supports unanticipated dynamic adaptation of Java software systems. By extending the Java virtual machine to add dynamic behavioural reflection it provides a platform for intercepting and handling operations such as object creation, method invocation, and field read and write. New behaviour may be inserted into Java applications at runtime without preprocessing or modifying the application source code or bytecode. Iguana/J provides a principled and structured framework for associating new behaviour with classes and objects. It uses the concept of metatypes to ensure that new behaviour is applied consistently to an application. Iguana/J's class library is small and simple to use.
the only downside I can see are for those who do not run a windows enviroment, seems you unix guys are shit out of luck :( so what do you guys think? :D [offtopic]can anyone confirm that first link is winterlove? it sure seems like someone with his knowledge[/offtopic]

item.title: New Idea for bot, no sourcecode or deob required
item.dc:creator: @eXemplar eXemplar
item.description:
@eXemplar wrote:

The more exacts you have, the more you break.

Not really, the more exacts you have the more you lock your users into specifics. If there's more 'exacts', wouldn't there be less general things that could break ?

Edit: Bleargh, no tabby likey.

On topic: I don't think this would be the best way of doing things, although a decent implementation would probably run well under that environment.

Read full topic

item.title: New Idea for bot, no sourcecode or deob required
item.dc:creator: @wL1 wL
item.description:
@wL1 wrote:

pplsuqbawlz:

Sun is easily hacked! You just don't know what you're doing silly!

And you can with sun, but a hackable jvm doesn't do anything except make your bot more dependant upon a specific way of things. The more exacts you have, the more you break.

Is there anything more you can to tell us than just very general statements?

moparisthebest:

the only downside I can see are for those who do not run a windows enviroment, seems you unix guys are shit out of luck

[offtopic]can anyone confirm that first link is winterlove? it sure seems like someone with his knowledge[/offtopic]

Don't worry, once I have a hacked VM the windows guys will be out of luck, so balance is restored again
wl=winterlove

Read full topic
